lines.text: Be like me, don't love anyone, so I'm called Amore.
The police are coming! Act nonchalant.
Not dead yet? I heard that work kills people.
Its an honest death.
Sleep at night instead of playing cards - you look like refugees from the morgue.
Were you there when he made the bet with German and Crazy People. Did he say he'd eat a kilo of potatoes and a whole cheese then swim and nothing would happen?
So he didn't die of indigestion, he died of exhaustion.
Don't you know you can't swim after a meal, you die. The change from hot to cold stops your digestion.
I've lost all my money but I've still got a ring to bet. Scared to bet?
I'll take you on, I want to kill you off.
There's room for all in the cemetary.
Sabina, if everyone was as brave as your brother we've won the war.
Work! That's blasphemy!
Accattone you owe me 1000 lire, pay up before you kill yourself.
Tell me your last wishes, what sort of funeral procession?
Friends follow the hearse, first one to weep buys the drinks.
What inscription on the tombstone?
Try it and See!
Aren't you going to take off your gold chain and bracelets?
No, I want to die wearing my gold like the pharoahs.
Give it to us!
No - if you want gold you have to swim for it.
Not even the river can stop Accattone!
I've got plenty of people left to make cry.

We're all washed-up and everybody avoids us. If we've money we're alright, if not we're nothing. We're finished because we're incapable of making it on our own. Today its better to be a thief than follow this despicable trade.
Remember us begging as kids? Your crying even upset the cops. But it doesn't work now, its disgusting.
Damned women, they take you to heaven then they drop you.
You needn't think you're staying home and not working tonight. Your not on social security you know.
You've ruined me. Otherwise I'd be a good worker, or a good thief.
Sing somewhere else - don't spew your booze up here!
You mean my fellow's no good? he's handsome and good and he likes me.
Do you like Neopolitans? We're something special.
Accattone you look worn-out.
Not at all. I'm a free citizen. My woman never came home last night. Someone nobbled her leg. I want to die.
Now he'll start selling holy pictures.
Documents. Who carries documents - I remember my name.
In the words of the prophet, today you sell your ring, tomorrow your watch, next week your chain and in 77 days you won't have eyes to cry with.
The cemetary's over there.
Give it my love.
Long live us thieves! We stretch out our hand and always get something.
Yes, a jail sentence.
We're born with a vocation. I was born with the instinct to thieve. You weren't born with the instinct of a pim so you're a beggar.
You want to pick a fight? Go and get killed somewhere else. I did alright.
Go back to thieving, there's no unemployment for thieves.
Where's my good wife?
Earning bread for her children. The less she sees of you the better.
One day someone will kill you.
We've been working since 6 o'clock this morning.
These rotten things can happen.
Its hard work?
Its a question of habit, if you need something you have to work.
I know what has to be done in Italy. Lincoln freed the slaves... but our rulers caused slavery. With a tommy gun in my hand there'd be few left!
Are you hungry?
No, ravenous.
Well, noon, time to eat.
You seem so nice, so young, so good and kind. I don't know how to put this. Are you from Rome?
You're lucky you don't understand.
Do I need a permit to talk to you?
Don't start acting a tragedy.
Let me lead my life and you live yours.
You were never any good for yourself, for me, for your son. You want to come back? There's no easy life here.
It was the biggest mistake of my life to believe you.
Aren't you cute. The peasants are revolting.
Dear Accattone. You've changed from day to night.
It is rumoured you haven't eaten for 2 days.
If I spew over you, you could eat for a week.

[to dog]
You're lucky, you can eat bones.
Is there a saint who protects the hungry? If you're there, help us.
What's hunger? A vice - its all in the mind. If they hadn't got used to eating as children... did your lousy father fill you with the vice of eating?
Do you remember when we stole from a blind man to get food.
And do you remember when we stole your father's false teeth
Hurry up with the pasta or we'll look like the guys at the Nuremberg trial.
We shall have some price left. Lets go and leave our pasta as an act of charity.
Pride! Pride in taking money from fallen women. Even in jail everyone despises the pimps.
If I get nothing because of you, you'd better run.

[Looking at prostitutes]
What are those girls doing?
Making money.
What do they do?
What all other women do.
You don't care about her. I do alright because I've got nobody.
Can't you talk of anything else?
Look at him, getting her off for work. The dirty peasant.
Do you mind us walking like this? Do you know I love you? I act fast when someone deserves it, like you.
Why do you love me?
Firstly because I like you. Second because you seem so strange, so unprotected.
I want to make a speech.
Mussolini made speeches.
This is serious, I want you to know everything about me.
Call me Accattone. There are lots of Vittorios but I'm the only Accattone.
In love! Are you telling me fairytales. If you told me he was starving I'd believe it but in love!
Everyday is a holiday for us. All you get is MayDay.
What is Accattone? The tough guy of Rome. Basically he's just stupid.
Up yours and anyone else who's against me.
Let him - the river takes everything.
Aren't you ashamed. Wash your face you silly drunk.
What should I have? See what I'm reduced to? I disgust myself. Do yo uknow what I was before I met you? I had a car, money, all I wanted. A gold chain, a gold watch, I was all gold.
So, get a job.
What, donating blood. No-one drinks my blood. Work. Animals work.
I thought you were different. I've never been mistaken before in my life.
I know what you're doing with me. I've been expecting it. I know what you want from me.
I've only known pain and misery. I'm not like the others. How do I know what I must and mustn't do?
The important thing is that we love each other. One day that will be all. Madonna make me a saint, I've already done my pennance.
Put your soul at ease, there's no hell and no heaven.
Amore make way for new talent, its time you were pensioned off.
The world today is a sewer. Now they all do it, more or less.
Now what? Nothing doing? Are you leaving me like this?
Anyone who mucks me about has had it.
Leave me alone, I won't go to the police station. I do as I please.
There's no loving in this world now.
You don't know him, he's capable of anything. Everything as long as he's alright. Even killing. You must arrest him. He's not fit to live.
There are 2 possibilities. Either I've gone mad or my brain's back.
You still got some masala? Happy days.
To tell the truth, Stella's found a roof. The first step has been taken.

[singing]
Just give me the will to work. Work for me dad, I'd rather shirk.
I thought work might be a pleasure... I'm not doing any more, its killing me!
What a bad effect work has on you.
You make me sick you dirty pimps.
How prosaic.
Either the world kills me or I kill it.
Accatone lets drink a drop, it bucks you up.
I haven't a lira, yesterday I even tried going to work.
What a disgrace.
The world belongs to those with teeth.
Cinderella's lost shoe gained her a prince. Yours would summon the fire brigade.
He who trusts in providence will never starve. Stella was right. My poor Stella.
Accattone, how are you?

[Dying]
Now I'm fine.
Don't even try to escape, we know who you are.
